Review Text: i read the book years ago and the movie was tops.....it was an honest story about girls growing up and remaining friends for life also was about a mother daughter relationship very true and honest very moving music was excellend and sandra bullock great...

profile:
The user has a strong preference for quality filmmaking, emphasizing well-executed scenes and strong performances by actors. They appreciate aesthetic and artistic elements, indicating a favor for visually appealing and artistically significant works. While they rated the storyline as merely "okay" in previous interactions, their recent review highlights a deeper appreciation for narrative themes, particularly those revolving around genuine relationships, such as friendship and the mother-daughter dynamic. This suggests that character-driven stories resonate with them, even if they have previously expressed a desire for narrative closure. 

The user noted that the film they reviewed featured excellent music and praised the performance of a lead actress, aligning with their history of favoring high-caliber cast members in their viewing choices. Their overall rating remains high, showcasing their willingness to overlook minor shortcomings in the narrative if other elements meet their standards, such as emotional authenticity and compelling performances. The frequent use of terms like "honest" and "moving" reflects their discerning taste, which leans towards productions that resonate on both an artistic and emotional level. In summary, they continue to prioritize well-crafted films that combine strong performances with meaningful themes, underscoring their appreciation for emotional depth and artistic execution alongside visual aspects.
